website_summaries.verdict: Compact black weather-resistant bike bag with hook-and-loop strap attachment and safety features, available in medium and large sizes.
pros: Water-resistant bag made with 100% polyester material
Large main compartment, 2 smaller side compartments, key clip, and mesh pocket provide ample space
Easy installation with hook-and-loop straps that attach to saddle and seat post
Safety features include reflective strips on sides and back, plus rear loop for light
cons: Some purchasers had difficulty securing bag snugly under bike seat due to issues with attachment straps
Adjustment possible, but requires buyer ingenuity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag in the large size which, though a little smaller that what I was expecting, ended up being a very good size. The side pockets are very small but they will hold a multi-tool on one side and tire irons with a very small patch kit on the other side. The inside holds two tube boxes and miscellaneous items. On the door is a hook for keys, a small mesh pocket and you can clip a rear light. In addition, there is reflective tape around the bag. The straps do an excellent job of holding the bag in place and seems to be designed to fit every road bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Seigel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike bag. Holds my phone and keys perfectly. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Rice

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Size of my seat!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations! Very roomy. Will hold my checkbook style wallet. Has 2 narrow side pockets. An inside a pocket key clip. Seems well made. Zippers appear to be sturdy. Has a nice rigid bottom that isn’t like a board. At first I thought it was too big, but able to store my backup flexible water shoes; when SPD SL shoes need to come off to walk around. Plus it perfectly matches my black and yellow Giant road bike. Love this product! Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Zon P

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag, very practical
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, easy to attach to my bike. I especially like the two side pockets, I can store small stuff such as keys, credit cards in them, separate from other stuff, avoiding get scratched. The main storage pouch is big enough for my belongings when I ride. It is very easy to detach the bag, and bring it with me. I totally love the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit standard saddle.
customer_reviews.text: The straps can't be adjusted to tighten down on my saddle or seat post, leaving the bag very loose. The bag itself seems decent, so if the straps weren't too long it would be a decent item. Unfortunately with the poorly sized straps, this won't fit well on bicycles with standard seats.
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag for the price, but tore after two years.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag just over two years, and it has plenty of room for all of the essentials; 2 tubes, multi tools, tubeless sealant and some tire levers. Installation is simple, though it does sag a little to make it less aero. The biggest drawback is durability; mine has developed a large tear on one of the seams, which is causing me to replace it. For the price two years isn't a horrible amount of time, but I would have expected it to last longer, I will be replacing with something different.
customer_reviews.author: Meags

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy inside liner
customer_reviews.text: The size of the bigger one is good and I like the two outside pockets for easy accessibility. However the inside section has one continuous hard plastic "liner" that helps it keep its shape. When I put it on the bike it buckled completely in on itself making the inside space much smaller. If I filled it it might go back to its shape but I only keep keys and a phone in there so it never went back to its shape and the plastic hits the phone. I'm not sure about the quality of the zipper - I had a little trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: lagunamama

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was great untilll
customer_reviews.text: So this replaced a bag I had on my bike for OVER 10 YEARS!! Within 1 YEAR this bag already is now ripping from the seam that is sewn on the strap that holds the bag up under the seat. The bag otherwise is great in size. It has side pockets for tools and such, so really disappointed how low quality the material and/or workmanship is .Its $15, but so what if it cant even last 5 or more years. Bike is parked indoors and I dont ride in the dirt either.
customer_reviews.author: AfterhourshopTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: The strap to secure this seat bag to a typical road bike saddle is too short
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a good seat bag for holding a larger sized cell phone such as the Samsung Galaxy A50. However, the strap to hold the bag to the saddle rails is simply too short - unless you have a saddle with rails no further apart than about 2" at the rear of the saddle, you won't be able to secure this bag to the saddle. I don't understand why Lumintrail didn't simply add another inch or two to the strap length.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Decently sized and good customer service
customer_reviews.text: My first had a manufacturing defect and ripped along one of the seams when I tugged on the zipper. However it was promptly replaced and after tugging every-which-way on the new one I have no problems. I'd have marked it down for the defect, except the customer service was prompt and courteous, and the bag I have now is exactly what I want. Roomy. I have 2 spare tubes and a patch kit in the large main pocket. One side pocket exactly fits my multitool, and the other holds 48g CO2 and the inflator. Everything you need for emergency repairs either commuting or on those long days in the saddle.
customer_reviews.author: That one guy

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Room pouch that fits an iPhone 7 plus other small items.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect underseat bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag to hold a few key items and it is perfect. I can fit a tire repair kit, keys to the lock and an emergency energy bar. I keep them in there and forget about it knowing it is there in an emergency. The bag secures well, and while it moves around I have had no issues even though I ride some pretty rough off-road trails. Good bag, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is large enough to hold your large cellular phone. As long as it’s not one of those crazy large phones. The side pockets have ample space for a set of keys or change/cash. I can easily pack a protein bar or some kind of snack in the main pouch as well. One of the best bags out there for the price.
customer_reviews.author: john clayton

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but if you are a bike snob like me with a high end bike, this may not be for you.
customer_reviews.text: A decent product for your kids or a novice or beginner road biker but it seemed to much like gadgetry for me and unshapely. However, if you are not a bike snob and are looking for an efficient storage bag for your bike and average looks are ok, then this one may be for you. No complaints for the price. I just think it looks a little funky.
customer_reviews.author: Safety Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but may not fit under all seats.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and it works. This actually doesn't fit under the seat for any of my bicycles, but I was easily able to attach it to other parts of the frame. I give it 4 stars because, once I found a place to attach it to my bike, it did not fail.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. DeLong

customer_reviews.title: If you ride a handcycle this is the one
customer_reviews.text: I am a handcycle rider and it is difficult to find a tool bag that will mount to it. This one fits fantastic with a single Velcro loop on the top and one towards the front. It easy holds 2 extra tubes, 3 CO2's, tire levers, a multi tool, my eppi pin, and all kinds of gells and cliff bars. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this for several months now and leave it on my bike. I'm able to fit a spare tube, hand pump, & C02 inflator w/canister of gas in the main compartment. On the right side, I have room for a second canister of CO2, tube patches, tire boot patches, and tire tools. On the left side, I have room for multi-purpose bike tool.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: I am not an avid rider. Since I bought and installed this bag in June, it have seen actions halve a dozen times with a granola bar and and a bike tool set stored inside. I just discovered a ripped in the seam for a bag just hanging there. It is very disappointing to see a bag just frayed in 2 month period with added weight of a bike tool in the side pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useful under saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: I received Lumintrail bag week ago. I selected large size. It fits good on my bike (Trek 8.2DS) with a long saddle post. Quality of materials and workmanship is good. It has useful strap on the back pocket, I attached to it a red blinker for safety. It is a useful add-on to my bike.
customer_reviews.author: iSergei

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design of this bag . HOWEVER, the straps are just sewn to the top of the bag fabric. Age, time, exposure to the elements, expect the fabric to start to rip from the strap. Would have been better if there was a solid backing inside the bag. Also, Would have liked the bag to be bigger.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Mid sized saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: This mid-sized bag is perfect for my extra tube, tire tools, flat repair kit, bike multitool and a wrench. There's still a small amount of room left. I don't think this would be water proof if you're in a wet area. I'm in Phoenix so all we have is dry weather.
customer_reviews.author: nictoanamide

customer_reviews.title: Carries A Lot Of Stuff - Seam Blown Out
customer_reviews.text: PRO - Carries a lot of stuff. I bought it for my iPhone. fits the phone, a spare tube, multi-tool and keys in the main bag and patch kit in the side. CON - Seam blew out after one month or two days after return limit expired. Will try to sew up.
customer_reviews.author: Maui Mikie

customer_reviews.title: Good bag but longer than normal
customer_reviews.text: Large size with two side pockets but it is too large for my seat and I had to fineagle it to attach tight enough so as not to bounce around. It holds far more than my previous saddle bag and I can now carry my mini pump and co2 w my spare tube and repair kit. Good bag overall, just a bit longer than I was expecting so it doesn’t tuck up under my seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Riemersma

customer_reviews.title: Well made, holds a surprising amount
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and takes a heck of a beating!! I fit a surprising amount in this little bag; emergency all tool, spare lights, inner tube, snacks, has a key hook, and reflection strips all sides, as well as a strap to affix a rear light or reflector.
customer_reviews.author: Momma

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after three or four rides
customer_reviews.text: Top seem fell apart after three or four rides a couple miles each on some bumpy trails true... But it was only holding some Alan Keyes an innertube and some patches. Not even filled up, but the top mean seem just disintegrated
customer_reviews.author: Branden M Hazlet

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and fits my bike well. Only small complaint is the side pockets zip about a quarter inch upside down so you have to make sure to zip it all the way if you want to keep your lock key in it as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Topherr89

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: I got the medium size bag. Size is just right if you don't want a real bulky bag. Especially nice are the side compartments which provide more organization capabilities than many other bags that utilize a single storage compartment. I can't comment on durability this soon. So far, everything works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: IJEFF

customer_reviews.title: Love the extra room
customer_reviews.text: I needed a larger bike bag to fit my longer phone. This fits great. Was a squeeze to get it attached under my bike seat, but that's because my seat is low due to my lack of height!
customer_reviews.author: Shannopin

customer_reviews.title: When you gotta carry stuff, this is your saddle bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is real good saddle bag. It's roomy, and those zippered side pockets are great for smaller things I need to get without digging. Looks cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce a.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and secure attachment
customer_reviews.text: Overall good quality. The material seems durable. The Velcro straps secure the bag well. The fit on my bike could be better - the bag is a little big for under my seat. Overall I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: it is good!
customer_reviews.text: This is what I am talking about as a good product. Well made, extra pockets, does not interfere with my rear lights. I can even clip an extra light outside the back pocket. I will definitely recommend this to any bike enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Alex-Biker

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Cycle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it fits a lot and has two side pouches but it's hard to install because of the size. Wish it was a little smaller but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Justmyopinion

customer_reviews.title: It's plenty  big
customer_reviews.text: Very big for the price and it came fast. It can hold 2 tubes (will hold co2 inflator and cartridges when I get them) phone, wallet, and side pockets for miscellaneous tools.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Casarian

customer_reviews.title: Roomy but wobbly!
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a good bag. It’s large enough for all the tools and gear I need for long rides. My only complaint is the way it connects to the seat is wobbly, I fixed it with my old bags strap which wraps all the way around the bag a secures it to the seat nice and tight. Seems like a simple design flaw any bicycle rider would notice immediately.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Nice, just didn't fit my bike saddle.
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough bag but too big and/or straps are in wrong place to fit behind the seat as it is made for. Thought about using it strapped to my bar, but occasionally my leg would hit it.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Good thinking!
customer_reviews.text: Great size! Extended zip out fabric I haven’t even had to use yet. Tucked away so neatly under the seat. I appreciate the reflective strips incorporated into the bag as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here. The bag itself is decent, but the straps are much too long. Even empty, the bag loosely hangs under the seat and flops around. Garbage design.
customer_reviews.author: David Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Ok bag for light use
customer_reviews.text: Only keep a small bike multitool and occasionally a cell phone in it, and the top seam has torn. Didn't like the upper strap design either, weak and allowed bag to bounce a lot since it went around the outside of the seat rails instead of up through middle and around bag. Did like the reflective tape all around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: I got the large bag it’s big enough to fit rent here and ratchet and L keys and a few other things perfect bike bag
customer_reviews.author: Cybertime0110

customer_reviews.title: A nice size, larger than most, but not too large.
customer_reviews.text: The size, I find most of my saddle bags are too small, but this one will work well for me and what I like to carry with me on rides!
customer_reviews.author: mark davenport

customer_reviews.title: Not for road bike aero frames or seat posts
customer_reviews.text: Straps not long enough to fit around my Kestral road bike with aero frame and seat post. Fits OK on my standard mountain bike though. We'll see how long is lasts....
customer_reviews.author: Ran-D

customer_reviews.title: The straps are not sturdy, the bag will keep swinging side-to-side during rides ...
customer_reviews.text: The bag holds a lot of items, but the straps for the seat is faulty. The straps are not sturdy, the bag will keep swinging side-to-side during rides - its very distracting.
customer_reviews.author: JediMax

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: Bag is a great size for a MTB and 29er fat tubes. Problem is that it has torn after about 10 rides. It was not over-filled with stuff and I am not a hard rider.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised and good value.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it do I can't report on long-term use. I like the pockets design and it is easily installed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Petrie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC. I love the small side zip pouches and good size on the main compartment. Great fabric strip on the back is perfect for holding my clip on rear light.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a good bag. Holds everything I take on bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: A little bit of Reality
customer_reviews.text: Kind of look bigger in the pictures. And i went to Walmart and found one 3 times bigger for only 5 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: TruthOverFear

customer_reviews.title: Not at all impressed
customer_reviews.text: The side pockets that fit a multi-tool and tire levers are nice and the reason why I bought this. It's a real pain to mount under the seat. I'm not sure what bicycle seat and post they designed this thing for? Not even 2 miles into the first ride the seam where the velcro strap attaches to the bag ripped. Returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Gerstenberg

customer_reviews.title: can't run wires like a battery for bike lights since there are no ...
customer_reviews.text: didn't feel very secure, a little larger than expected, can't run wires like a battery for bike lights since there are no ports designed for it.
customer_reviews.author: Doublej70

customer_reviews.title: I really like the side zippered pockets too - they easily hold ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not quite as large as I expected but it's still more than enough space to put a patch kit, phone and bike tool. I really like the side zippered pockets too - they easily hold additional small items such as keys and tissues. overall, I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that they didnt put enough velcro ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that they didnt put enough velcro on the straps. I had to use a plastic ziptie to hold it down since one of the straps didnt have enough velcro to attach to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: XL if you want it
customer_reviews.text: Very large bike bag, high quality, lots of storage room.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Putnick

customer_reviews.title: Love the Pockets But it moves a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like the extra pockets But it keeps moving..hard 2 secure it But 2 pockets r Gr8!
customer_reviews.author: Vince C.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product very good price. Lots of storage for tools!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Head

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made bag
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made bag. Fit perfectly on my new Santa Cruz Chameleon. Heavy duty zippers and plenty of room. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Jake S.

customer_reviews.title: Saddle requirements
customer_reviews.text: The attachment underneath the saddle is very dependent on what type of saddle you have the more streamline the poor of the fit.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Large bag. Fits my bike cable and lock and two tire tubes. Material and zippers seem very rugged and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: bicycle bag
customer_reviews.text: easy to attach and nice extra space on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: bob M

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP STRAPS
customer_reviews.text: Straps are cheaply made. Strap on top will not tighten down on the saddle and fasten because the strap is to long and Velcro will not fasten to itself, very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL

customer_reviews.title: Great bike bag
customer_reviews.text: This bike bag is the perfect size and holds just what we need!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Holds my phone, wallet, & keys. Still has room.
customer_reviews.author: It's me, Dave

customer_reviews.title: Holds beer
customer_reviews.text: Side pockets holds a spare tube on one side, CO2 cartridges in the other with room for a beer or a rain jacket in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B.

customer_reviews.title: Big, but poor design
customer_reviews.text: The back strap attaches in one spot to the saddle bag. As a result it’s swings left and right while you r riding. It’s already starting to wear at the attachment and I expect the strap to detach from the saddlebag . If you actually mountain bike, this is a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: mark c.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. I would have purchased the larger one as the medium is a good size, but a little bigger probably wouldn't have caused any difficulty with installing and would have given more room.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Rico

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality bag but does not fit snug up under ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality bag but does not fit snug up under seat. It hangs down quite a bit on the seat post end. Maybe I ordered the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Whitmer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design with the top strap.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my mountain bike and used it for 3 rides. I loaded it with a spare tube, multi-tool, and tire patch kit. The top of the bag ripped after the second trip. It needs a strap to go all the way around the bag to support the weight.
customer_reviews.author: D. Clegg

customer_reviews.title: While I love the compartments
customer_reviews.text: While I love the compartments, it doesn't secure to the bike seat post as tightly as I would like. It is constantly swaying as I ride and my thighs touch it as well which is annoying. However customer service is the best at Lumintrail! When I explained the problem they gladly offered me a full refund!
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag and loved it. Plenty of room for tools, keys, and phone. Good price and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am quite pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with this product! It fits all kinds of tools and a Cliff Bars and extras. Also pleased with the fit and the way I can clip a rear light onto it. With the low cost, it's a great value!
customer_reviews.author: CBO

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, zippers work well. Good fit for my bike seat
customer_reviews.author: Kara Runyan

customer_reviews.title: The nylon strap unraveled.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic snap fell off because the thread at the end of the nylon strap unraveled. The nylon strap is now to short to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Ski Trees

customer_reviews.title: ... my road bike I can carry everything I need love it.
customer_reviews.text: I got the large and it's bigger than it looks but after attaching to my road bike I can carry everything I need love it.
customer_reviews.author: bentley albury

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for space when I ordered this product and read on another review that the bag won't touch you when cycling. Definitely got a product with ample space but won't be using it much because I can definitely feel the bag against my legs when paddling.
customer_reviews.author: Berns

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect! I need these for my tools can hitch a ride with me..
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! I need these for my tools can hitch a ride with me..
customer_reviews.author: Juan M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Tore at seams
customer_reviews.text: Only been on a handful of rides and it’s tearing at the seams. Would not buy again. Unfortunately bought last year and waited to use until this year so past return window.
customer_reviews.author: kim w.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Mountain Bike fine, but was bought for the Road Bike
customer_reviews.text: Product is quality, just a little too big for my Road Bike. Fits Mountain Bike fine, but was bought for the Road Bike. Plenty of space inside the pouches. Really well made
customer_reviews.author: Haji Oerets

customer_reviews.title: Ripped wide open (< 1 month)
customer_reviews.text: The entire upper side of the bag ripped wide open at the seam less than a month into use. I hate writing bad reviews but be aware you'll need to be VERY gentle with this (unless I happened to get a 'lemon').
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Not well-made
customer_reviews.text: I like the roominess, wide opening on the main compartment, and fact that it has two side pockets. Unfortunately, it is flimsy and cheaply made. It ripped in two places after just a few months of normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Too loose.
customer_reviews.text: Velcro loops are too large to fasten bag tightly at seat post.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile, especially if you want to carry things like energy bars and not have to smash them in with everything else. Mounts easily and securely. Only problem would be if you have something “wide” you would like to carry as it narrows toward the rear.
customer_reviews.author: wade walburn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the space available. Not too bulky when attached on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: CruzP

customer_reviews.title: I'm Loving It
customer_reviews.text: Nice price. Fits just right under my seat. I like the compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Cee

customer_reviews.title: Not a ton of storage space
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but be sure to measure for the size you want.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for me. Big enough to put my phone and keys in and some other stuff. Straps on well and stays out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Marty P

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever!
customer_reviews.text: i absolutely love this saddle bag! It has blenty of room for my tube, multitool, and bike leavers with room left over for my smart phone. The outer pockets are perfect for carrying extra gels. There is an inner mesh pocket that's perfect for extra master maser liks and car keys.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great Saddle Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great saddle bag for the price, easy to install and has plenty of room to fit everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Rodsterman68

customer_reviews.title: Large Storage
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for long trips. Love the two side compartments for carrying smaller items.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: love the size
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of getting in and out of the bag. Also really like the 2 extra seperate zipped compartments on each side.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Large enough to fit a cell phone and a few other incidentals. I originally purchased a different pack and it was so small I couldn't even zip it with my cell phone in it. This one is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ballo

customer_reviews.title: Prompt delivery
customer_reviews.text: Great product, slightly bigger than I expected but overall pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: carole

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this product!
customer_reviews.text: Just what my grandson wanted! He liked the extra little zip compartments on either side!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Stinski

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than most saddles. I really like this one. Holds a ton of extras.
customer_reviews.author: deveren addison

customer_reviews.title: Not very snug once installed
customer_reviews.text: The strapping system could be better, good quality bag but is very loose once installed
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping and perfect fit. Hopefully yrs of service and rides.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: this product fit very poorly on several bikes we tried to fit it on. It also ripped out after one use. I bought two and they are both trash.
customer_reviews.author: heath anderson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag to tote your phone, wallet and such along on your ride.
customer_reviews.author: paul racioppo

customer_reviews.title: Practical Utility
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag to keep my bike tools, patches, and house keys while I'm on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Toca

customer_reviews.title: Poor product quality.
customer_reviews.text: Tore on both sides at seams along top edge after about 6 months of riding. Purchased Aug 2019. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not for rough terrain
customer_reviews.text: This thing is good for rail trails at the roughest. I took it mountain biking yesterday and had my phone and wallet in it. The zipper defied gravity and was halfway open when finally noticed it - almost lost my stuff
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Ripped twice after having it on a bike. Not the best quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Lumintrail Strap-on Bike Saddle Bag Bicycle Cycling Under Seat Pack Medium or Large
feature_bullets: COMPACT BUT ROOMY: Lumintrail saddle bag fits neatly under bike seat. One large main compartment with key clip and mesh pocket and and 2 smaller side compartments conveniently store essentials.
DURABLE CONSTRUCTION: 100% polyester weather resistant material keeps contents safe
QUICK & EASY INSTALLATION - Tool-free “Snap-on” design with two adjustable velcro straps attach to saddle and seatpost in seconds and hold bag firmly in place.
ADDED SECURITY: Reflective strips on three sides and tail light loop for increased night time visibility

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
